snippet.title: Jason Dundas opens up about his naked selfie
snippet.content: TELEVISION presenter and model Jason Dundas has opened up about the vexing motivation behind his controversial nude selfie on social media. He said his naked selfie was a cheeky statement against the over-sexualised nature of social media. "I jumped on the bandwagon to poke fun, but I started getting smashed with (direct messages) saying your account is about to be ripped down," he said. "Clothes are overrated. Little afternoon stretch in my yoga room," Dundas posted with a naked shot on Instagram earlier this year. An hour later, the post was deleted. Dundas told Confidential: "I've got this love-hate relationship with Instagram. Whenever I post things, I lose followers. When I don't post things, I gain followers. "I'm just so confused about it. And I'm so frustrated with people posting blatant sexuality that gets a huge following. I try to be honest, educate people, share experiences and be vulnerable. Originally published as
